page.title: 03 ROYAL PAVILION
page.content: The Royal Pavilion is the most important historical building in Brighton.Building began on the pavilion in the late 18th century and was finished early in the 19th century ,for who was then George,the Prince of Wales (he was Prince Regent 1810-20 and King George IV 1820-30). The principal architects were Henry Holland and John Nash.The style of the building is approximately Indian on the outside and Chinese on the inside,with many Regency features as well.It is a unique blend of contrasting styles of architecture which people which people often love or hate. The Prince Regent loved it,but Queen Victoria loathed it.She sold it to Brighton Town Council in 1850,so it now belongs to the people of Brighton.
